text: we're standing next to the Columbia
River which is truly the lifeblood of
the Pacific Northwest
this is the gold this is what those of
us who care about cleanup at Hanford are
trying to protect but protecting the
environment wasn't the priority seventy
years ago when Hanford began producing
plutonium for nuclear weapons when the
effort site was created during World War
Two there was an a sense of urgency we
were worried as a country about winning
world war two about protecting our
fighting men and women so there wasn't
much thought given to the disposal of
what they were creating from 1940s on
this was a secret site times people
remained proud of the role Hanford
played in America's war effort but a new
generation is looking ahead I've seen
this area really embrace clean up and we
have an obligation to educate our
children to continue this struggle we
have to pass that baton on it's going to
go on for yet another generation anyone
who's been out to the site and doesn't
work for any length of time six months
to a year or longer if they get some
time to view the radioactive areas they
understand that the magnitude is as
large as anything they've ever
experienced in their life
fortunately for Hanford high school
students seem committed to helping their
community they also realize that
cleaning up contamination provides jobs
and economic benefits if that project
was done a lot of parents wouldn't have
jobs and a lot of families would have to
find new jobs and there would be a lot
of concern there so I'm I'm kind of
happy that it's still going on
honestly there's people here we're all
really geared towards science and math
and we're always really really willing
to solve our problems
I do like biology and chemistry and plan
on taking three science classes next
year and it kind of as a family thing my
uncle's but a microbiologist my mom's
biologists getting rid of decades of
nuclear waste is costly and
time-consuming and there have been
setbacks but most residents understand
the need for patience I would rather
have it done right than fast
